gracchi sicily slave spain viriatus asia aristonicus tiberius gracchus tribune people petitioned poore souldiers law called agrariae put execution lawes none souldiers could enjoy acre land neither must richer sort buy poorer estate gracchus urged execution lawes also treasure left king attalus might distributed among poor thing hee opposed rich men chiefly c antonius consul octavius tribune gracchus unusual way tooke away tribunate hee also strove continue government law upon scipio nasica chief pontifiee call senat capitoll accompanied thither great multitude made gracchus friend forsake striving escape slaine colleague satureius citizen whose body flung tibris body tiberius lay unburied fell urbis yeares carbo tribune people made motion senat man might chosen tribun often presaged birth hermophrodite rome haruspices drowned cecilius metellus c fab max servilianus consul another burned alive beginning marsian warre much time manlius torquatus caused sonne iunias silanus pretor macedon put death oppressing macedonian unjust tax also c matienus accused deserting army spain whipped furca gallows long pole laid upon two erected forkes sold slave mancinus consul numantia ill successe warres forced make dishonourable peace senat would ratifie roman overthrowne numantians mancinus made stand naked hand bound behinde gate numantia till night forsaken friend exposed spectacle misery enemy iun brutus inward part spaine overthrew gallecians came aide lusitanians battaile slaine taken rest fled hither spain lepidus proconsul beaten vaccei deservedly would submitted senat interceded harmlesse people yet would need provoke fight skirmish hee lost roman rest fled rome vindicate loss affront sustained numantians c pulvius joined p scipio chosen consul tribune time none could law consul twice till expiration ten yeares scipio therefore besiegeth numantia seated hill wall mile compasse towne received entertained roman fugitive much afflicted army pompey popilius mancinus scipio sodainly fall upon first trained exercised souldiers reducing degree idlenesse loose behaviour old military severity man fortunate courageous magnificent gave list rich present sent antiochus sedetes senat might distribute best deserving souldiers whereas generalls used conceal present sent prince numantians would submitted upon tolerable condition could obtain drunk largely wine dea bribery got himselfe bee made tribune never rested till cicero banished caesar accused murthering lentulus cethegus consul thus cicero forced night time depart city returned moneths time returned received great joy time clodius tribune got act passe cyprus wealth thereof brought publick treasure revenged king cyprus refused ransome clodius heretofore taken prisoner pyrats king hearing act poysoned himselfe cato imployed businesse brings rome wealth cyprus ptolemy nothing left egypt brother dead cyprus lost therefore labour earnestly make roman friend power small home could save one roman ignorantly killed cat sacred creature among egyptian punishment last exaction hee driven kingdome alexandrian crowned berenice eldest daughter though son shee legitimate queen shortly marriage strangles cybiofactes husband sordid basenesse marries archelaus called son mithridates whereas indeed son archelaus warred sylla greece chap vi caesar exploit gallia germany britain affaire rome windes unserviceablenesse ship yet partly roman valour partly stratagem sharp hooke fastned long pole laid athwart rope crosse mast cut sailes fell could doe service enemy caesar got victory time q first ptolemey yeelded neck roman yoake generall peace gave way birth prince peace hand came fulnesse time destroy idolatry hight rome pantheon temple built god ephesus nicea nicomedia pergamus temple dedicated iulius augustus ephesus city rome made goddesse sacrifice offered theater erected jerusalem holy city polluted vanity profanenesse gentile swordplaying stageplaying herod upon suspition murthers vertuous wife mariamne mother law alexandra sanhedrin senator set golden eagle porch temple augustus took order furnishing city yeerly corn egypt sent honest able proconsul province reformed senat reduced number senator hee gave order priest transcribe genuine bookes sibyl burne supposititious overthrew house vedius pollio feeding lamprey men flesh hee maintained strong guard himselfe prevent mischievous plot malecontents desired build upon ruines state many conspiracy intended sometimes resolved betake private life yet guard maintained three cohortes within city gave liberty jew every asia cyrene use religion grieved losse varus three legion germany sometimes would beat head wall cry varus restore legion would called dominus lord herod rebuilt samaria called sebaste augustus gluttony covetousnesse souldiers demanded donative answered hee used choose buy souldiers speech distastfull souldiers used receive generalls donatives military reward either adorea measure corn chain devoured great hogge iustin shew zeale c councell chalcedon called wife dupicina name euphemia martyr whose church councell held recalld catholicks banishment exiled arians eutychians thrust severus war iustin hired gold zeliobes king hun assist invited persian greater summe forsook iustin assisted persian iustin letter acquainted cabades dishonest king served could deny hee received money whereat cabades incensed slew many hun escaped flight peace made iustin sincerity lasted long tsathius king lazors colchi revolting persian came iustin receives christian religion baptized therefore hee called king iustin sent back colchis subject persian caused quarrell colchi hun join iustin persian cabades aged sickly desired sonne cosroes might bee adopted iustin beene done proclus treasurer disswaded dangerous himselfe iustinian upon quarrell grew greater cabades iustins enemy advancing tsathius theodoricus veronensis also persecuting arians pope iohn first successour hormisdas boetius symmachus came intreat iustin hee would bee rigid arians lest theodoricus use rigour dominion catholicks embassadours honourably entertained great joy see pope constantinople patriarch iustin would bee crowned hee first emperour crowned pope theodoricus hearing inraged thinking embassadours plotted iustin western dominion therefore starved iohn prison slew two said follower dyed shortly c daughter amalasunta succeeded young sonne athalaricus reigned together yeares restored franc part gallia grand father taken death alaricus amalasunta made theodatus cousin german colleague kingdome shee used reprove freely loose manner shee also put death three prime men goth telling young alaricus stood greatnesse prince bee mother ferula shee good towards sonne cousin lost life command theodatus shee strangled bath eudoxia daughter valentinian third instructed sonne childericus hee obtained kingdom vandal africa death tharsimund broke oath father made sweare persecute catholicks hearkening mother called home banished bishop iustin mean time reigned yeares lived dyed grief overthrow antiochia earthquake euphrasius bishop million people perished foure moneths death hee nominated sister sonne iustinian emperour time manichee utterly destroyed king cabades persia poysoned son phatuarsas heresy tampering bring innovation kingdom clodovejus four sonnes divided kingdom amongst entertain peace alamaricus son alarinus marry sister clotilda alaricus king spain aquitain marryed amalasintha daughter theodoricus king italy shee learned greeke latin tongue besides diver vulgar language whereas iustin emperour could neither write read alamaricus marryed tottilla daughter king clodovejus hee used roughly holding firm catholick religion caused warre childebertus succeeded clodoveus almaricus lost life benedict instituted order benedictin monkes slavi people scythia invaded istria border venetia time mauritius transplanted bohemia polonia histrians upon vanity vanity vanity thus kingdome vandal extinguished africa continued since first comming thither yeares iustinian divided afric seven province three consular four praetorian three appointed consul bestowed burgundians dyed plague picenum great famine mother eat child famine drove franc back gallia wherefore vitiges great straight solicited cosroes persian make warre upon emperour otherwayes like bring force italy meane belisarius tooke ravenna vitiges submits goth proffered belisarius empire italy refused retorning home upon iustinians command carryed vitiges whose stead goth beyond strict discipline army totilas executed kinsman lying maid whose whole estate bestowed italy danger lost belisarius called back persia sent italy hee could doe little good old souldiers either al gone else grown stubborn therefore totilas take rome betrayed almost starved overthrowes part wall abstained slaughter england occa king cantium invited saxon arthur king britaines disappointed permitted returnes italy take tarentum spoletum rome hee fortysieth persian warre renewed cosroes hee againe commanded thither whose departure gave occasion totilas overrunne againe italy hee obtaines also rome cals longobards italy king alboinus made scruple exchange poore pannonia rich italy c thither came accompanyed saxon nation leaving pannonia hun conditionally thing fell mindes italy might injoy ardamanes new force far neer wasted eastern empire sophia wife iustin become phrenetick upon bad successe forced sue peace iustin recovered advice wife made tiberius thracian good souldier successour hee gave many wholesome admonition hee shewed himselfe better counsellour emperor grieving folly miscarriage dyed yeare reigne time cantabria subdued visigoth overthrown suevi made toletum regall seat caganus take many souldiers prisoner refused contribute towards charge armes clothes yet tooke captive hee offered release small sum mauritius hatred avarice refused pay wherefore chaganus rage put sword would depart thence till received great sum gold mauritius little sensible done absolved commentiolus hee accused chief actor treachery accusors punished incensed people slung stone emperor conquered also island aradus much opposition constantinople delivered siege two sonnes certain trumpeter broke prison doores slew amiras set fleet fire muhavias prepared new fleet hee beat constantine yeares sufficient rule state slighted kept like child ferula resolve take government upon himselfe shee side part share power keepes sonne home correction yeares age banisheth adhere make souldiers sweare fidelity alone acknowledge power whilest alive armenian army constant loyalty constantine would acknowledge mother soveraignty whose example moved souldiers oath fall empresse therefore constantine helpe take reines owne hand command stauratius forbeare meddling state affaire confines mother palace eleutherium shee lately built shee entertained princely respect next year intending expedition bulgaria another arabia restores former power shee obtained shee fell vex punish friend acquaintance hee make expedition bulgaria ill successe army defeated chiefest nobility either killed taken prisoner upon suspition treason hee caused three uncle nicephorus christophorus nicetus apprehended eys put cruelty made hated chiefly armenian make himselfe odious hee put away wife mary pretending shee would poysoned whereas known vertuous religious lady puft good successe lately saracen take one theodate virgin nunnery make empresse iucensed monk accused bigamy banished constantine make second expedition bulgaria take could tribute insolently demanded understanding wife brought bed sonne hee repaires city commends charge army mother shee take absence sonne fit opportunity reinvest selfe soveraignty end shee stauratius bribe flattery worke upon army whose good shee obtained upon emperour called home saracen war intent apprehend secure done accordingly thought escaped could wherefore hee brought back city eye put yeares hee served uncle c day long dyed death accompanied dayes darknesse eye world disdaining looke thrust eye soveraign hee reigned yeares alone mother reigned yeares time shee put death husband uncle might aspire empire embassadours sent charles confirming solid peace parting empire making match charles hee likewise sends embassadours constantinople effect whilest great change fell irene sick given grandee nominated nicephorus patrician succeed empire upon saluted emperour army hee give oath allegiance besiegeth irene palace make deliver treasure banisheth isle lesbos shee secured strong guard shee pined away griefe dyed reigned yeares nicephorus dispatcheth embassadours letter charles desiring ratification peace propounded irene charles subdued saxon hee translates great number flanders brabant hee beat sclavi vinidi plundering magdeburg hee take thassilo sonne law desiderius wife perswasion renewed rebellion hee condemnes treason sends monastery charles also suppressed hungarian thassiloes associate invaded germany year warre subdued hun quieted pannonia charles assembleth synod francfurd bishop wherein nestorianism condemned elipandus felix two bishop renewed defined christ according flesh true sonne god adopted humanity worshipped lesse divinity image worship condemned second synod nice rejected alphonsus also king asturia gallicia spaine wearyed payment virgin exacted saracen way attribute resolve fight accordingly battell hee defeated took lysbone killed many freed great part spain saracen yoak ensign victory sends charles stephen fourth third say sate year succeeded adrian first sate yeares ordained every day poore people fed lateran court leo time coffin chest stone digged ground christ shall born virgin beleeve ingraven dead body found thought bee plato found little warres charles avares boii whose last king tassilo hee tooke sonne put monastery time england invaded dane yeare university paris onely every hundreth captain one eye conduct rest hee sent samuel affrigted many calamitous people became suddenly verriginous within two dayes dyed cousin german bladislabus revenged raised army also caused sweare shee would never marry leave empire except three son michael andronicus constantine shee therefore undertook government finding empire much weakened enemy thereof increasing dayly need stronger defender self resolve break oath marryeth month husband death romanus diogenes good souldier became emperour shortly diogenes promise made eudocia excludes government undertakes empire alone brother death became absolute duke normandy hee kept good correspondency scotland france hee sent wale colony flemmings much infested countrey debate earl flanders payment pension earl claimed debate stephen geffery william first parliament henry established salisbury consisting three estate yeares death anselme ralph bishop rochester made archbishop king give investiture thurston king chaplaine designed yorke refuseth sweare obedience canterbury appeales pope absolves invests give pall king forced submit also pope last reigned yeares surfeted lamprey dyed buryed abby reading founded erected two bishopricks ely carlyle founded monastery c rcester reading shyrborne hee compounded withpriests annuall pension keep wife levyed two tax people one maintain war france preferre daughter marriage emperour ended issue male conqueror built mannor woodstock inclosed park stone wall scotland malcolme dead crowne usurped donald assisted end king norreway exasperated people sent duncan malcolmes sonne england upon whose approach donald fled forsaken people sixth moneth hee invaded kingdome neither duncan continue long government harsh hee hated people upon donald got makpender earle mermes murther returning banishment invaded crowne againe third yeare second invasion hee taken imprisoned first lost eye life donald malcolmes brother succeeds edgar malcolmes sonne lived peaceably year built monastery coldingam dying without issue brother alexander succeeded king beginning reign assaulted army discontented youth kingdom defeated near river spaea afterward hee assaulted night asleep assasinates let one groomes bedchamber suddenly awaked flew sword killed groom six assasinats hotly persued rest escaped delivery built church st michael scone also escaped drowning storme erected charles father attained crown duke iohn shall inherit dutchy duke magnus duke gustavus adolphus dye without issue male brother duke charles philip male body lawfully begotten shall succeed crown fail sigismunds army seised camp money caused deliver chancellour incendiary punishment successeful war dane christianus denmark sent herauld charles restoring danish ship took slighted answer returned city pontus people sends christian prince aid turk bewailing miserable condition christendome dolphin burgundians countrey resolve goe turk father sends first come speak hee refused doe wherefore king sends pope know way might disinherit disobedient son pope commends dolphin real reproves king also animates french stand dolphin noble intention shewing valour devotion predecessor subduing barbarous infidel duke burgundy also protest make voyage send army turk dolphin son born hee called duke normandy king mistrusting poisoned refused touch victual last importuned eat friend tried could swallow ressistance reason regent absence domestick distraction waste marcia teviot upon return scot borderer plunder northumberland howard forced come back much losse party took iadburg time five hundred english horse suddenly affrighted dark broke halter run away mad last became prey scot three dayes english army disbanded regent perceiving english fleet lay still wait gave would remove france till next spring whereupon english fleet returned home soon gone regent clap three thousand french foot besides one hundred courisiers fifty ship arrives safely scotland king henry england time much court scot union alledging diver reason union england would advantagious france respect vicinity identity language soile aire condition countenance habit body shewing also marriage daughter mary king iames would make perfect union much increase happinesse scotland notwithstanding french faction bribed carried king henry alledged first time english deluded shews friendship union edward first oath bound
